meanings.definition: Not neat or orderly in appearance or arrangement.
meanings.sent1: The room was the untidiest I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: Her desk was always the untidiest in the office.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, his attempts to clean up always ended in the untidiest mess.
meanings.sent4: The garden after the storm looked like the untidiest painting.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen was the untidiest room in the house, with dishes piled high and crumbs everywhere.

meanings.sent1: The untidiest corner of the garage was filled with old boxes and tools.
meanings.sent2: The untidiest student in the class always had papers scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into the untidiest affair when the ants invaded the food.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like the untidiest closet, cluttered with thoughts and worries.
meanings.sent5: The car was the untidiest it had ever been, with trash covering the seats and floor.
